edu.ncsu.csc216.movie_inventory

Class MovieInventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.movie_inventory.MovieInventory

  • public class MovieInventory
extends java.lang.Object
    The MovieInventory class stores a list of unique Movie objects. This list is stored in an array, and is used by MovieInventoryUI to store user input.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sarah Heckman (sarah_heckman@ncsu.edu), Chris Bollinger (cwbollin@ncsu.edu)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MovieInventory()
      Constructs a MovieInventory object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addMovie(Movie m)
      Returns true if the Movie can be added to the inventory.
      static int getInventorySize()
      Gets the storage size of this MovieInventory.
      java.lang.String readMovie(int i)
      Finds the movie at the ith position of movies[], and returns it's toString() representation.
      boolean removeMovie(java.lang.String title)
      Removes the first movie in movies[] whose title matches the parameter.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovieInventory

        public MovieInventory()
        Constructs a MovieInventory object. Initializes movies as an array of Movie objects of size INVENTORY_SIZE.

    • Method Detail

      • addMovie

        public boolean addMovie(Movie m)
        Returns true if the Movie can be added to the inventory. If the Movie is a duplicate or if there is no more space, the method returns false.
        Parameters:
        m - Movie to add to the inventory
        Returns:
        true if the Movie can be added to the inventory, false otherwise.

      • readMovie

        public java.lang.String readMovie(int i)
        Finds the movie at the ith position of movies[], and returns it's toString() representation.
        Parameters:
        i - The position in movies[] of the movie to read. Should be a number between 0 and INVENTORY_SIZE-1, inclusive.
        Returns:
        The toString representation of the Movie at position i in movies[]

      • getInventorySize

        public static int getInventorySize()
        Gets the storage size of this MovieInventory.
        Returns:
        INVENTORY_SIZE, a constant which determines the number of movies that can be stored in MovieInventory.

      • removeMovie

        public boolean removeMovie(java.lang.String title)
        Removes the first movie in movies[] whose title matches the parameter. Will not do anything to the list if there is no matching title.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the movie to removed.
        Returns:
        true if the movie is successfully removed, false otherwise.
